summary: This document is an email chain from December 2019 discussing the potential participation of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman in a Safe Horizon event in Times Square to publicize New York's Child Victims Act. The discussion includes considerations about the event's impact on the ongoing Epstein investigation and mentions the possibility of inviting Epstein victims to participate.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The primary subject of the email chain; his potential participation in a Safe Horizon press conference to publicize the Child Victims Act is being discussed and approved, subject to EOUSA concurrence.

persons.name: Alexis Grenell
persons.role: Public Relations person working with Safe Horizon
persons.context: The PR person following up to confirm Geoffrey Berman's participation in the Safe Horizon event and coordinating the event details.

persons.name: Michael Polenberg
persons.context: A representative from Safe Horizon who is organizing the event and mentioned contemplating inviting victims of Jeffrey Epstein to participate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject of the ongoing investigation; his victims are considered as potential participants in the Child Victims Act event.

connections.description: Polenberg is seeking Berman's participation in a Safe Horizon event he is organizing.
Grenell is the PR person working with Safe Horizon and is following up on a conversation with Polenberg regarding the event.
Berman's office is conducting an ongoing Epstein-related investigation, and the event discussion considers its potential impact.

events.title: Planned Safe Horizon Press Conference for Child Victims Act
events.description: A planned press conference in Times Square to publicize the New York State Child Victims Act on its one-year anniversary, to advise survivors of the filing window.

events.title: Enactment of New York State Child Victims Act
events.description: The Child Victims Act was enacted, creating a one-year window for adult survivors of child sexual abuse to file civil suits regardless of statutes of limitations.

events.title: Child Victims Act Filing Window Opens
events.description: The one-year window for filing civil suits under the Child Victims Act began.

keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman's participation in a Child Victims Act event was tentatively approved, pending EOUSA concurrence.
The event organizers (Safe Horizon) contemplated inviting victims of Jeffrey Epstein to participate in the press conference.
The correspondence shows explicit consideration that the event should not negatively impact the ongoing Epstein-related investigation.
The Child Victims Act created a critical one-year window for survivors to file civil suits, which was actively being publicized in late 2019/early 2020.
